SEARCH
Package com.bookapp.client

Class BookClient

java.lang.Object
com.bookapp.client.BookClient
public class BookClient extends Object
The BookClient class is a client application that interacts with the book management system. It provides a command-line interface for performing various operations related to books, such as adding, retrieving, and sorting books. This class serves as the entry point for interacting with the implemented methods from the IBook interface.

The class demonstrates the use of a scanner to read user input from the console, and it handles several types of exceptions related to book operations, such as:

  • AuthorNotFoundException - Thrown when a book author is not found.
  • CategoryNotFoundException - Thrown when a book category is not found.
  • IdNotFoundException - Thrown when a book ID is not found.
  • PriceNotAvailableException - Thrown when the price of a book is not available.
  • TitleNotFoundException - Thrown when a book title is not found.

The main functionality of this class includes:

  • Adding multiple books to the system with user-provided details.
  • Retrieving books based on various criteria such as ID, title, author, category, and price.
  • Sorting books based on a specified field.
  • Providing a menu-driven interface to choose between different operations.

The following options are available to the user:

  • List all books.
  • Get a book by its ID.
  • Get a book by its title.
  • Get a book by its author.
  • Get a book by its category.
  • Get a book by its price.
  • Sort books by a specified field.
  • Exit the application.

Errors are handled gracefully by catching specific exceptions for each operation and displaying appropriate messages to the user. The application continues to prompt the user for input until the user chooses to exit.

Author:
MonigaBalasubramanian

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The entry point of the application. This method initializes the book management system and provides a command-line interface for the user to interact with the system. It handles user input, performs various operations on the book data, and manages exceptions related to book operations.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used in this implementation)
